page.title: 16Religion in New Mills
page.content: The church of St.Georges was consecrated in 1831. New Mills became an ecclesiastical parish in 1844 and St.Georges became the parish church. It was renovated in 1897.The oldest religous body to have a place of worship in New Mills is the Society of Friends which established a meeting house in Low Leighton in 1717.The town has been a stronghold of Methodism over the years. A Methodist Church was built in High Street in 1766. This church became a Sunday School when another church was built on St.Georges Road in 1810. Congregational Churches were built on Mellor Road in 1823.The Roman Catholic Church of the Annunciation on St.Marys road which cost Â£4,000 was consecrated in 1845. The Salvation Army meeting place was originaly on Meal Street and later on Market Street.
